article.headline: UNC-Asheville 69, Lenoir-Rhyne 59
article.story: ASHEVILLE, N.C. (AP) -- Bryan Smithson scored 18 points and helped UNC-Asheville snap a four-game losing streak in a 69-59 victory over Lenoir-Rhyne on Tuesday. Smithson had five steals and led four Bulldogs in double-digit scoring to hand the Bears (3-1) their first loss of the season. Joey Harrell finished with 12 points and nine rebounds, K.J. Garland added 11 points and Vincent James finished with 10 points for UNC-Asheville (2-4). The Bulldogs were 17-of-21 from the free-throw line for a season-high 81 percent. Josh Kindred led Lenoir-Rhyne with a game-high 19 points, while Reggie Bratton added 17 points and 10 rebounds. UNC-Asheville went on a 23-7 run midway through the first half to lead 30-14. Lenoir-Rhyne came back in the final five minutes with a 15-4 run and closed the gap to 34-29 at the break. The Bears got as close as 38-37 early in the second half but never overcame the Bulldogs, who went on a 16-4 run to widen their lead to 65-51 with 4:04 left in the game. UNC-Asheville forced the Bears into 23 turnovers that netted 26 points for the Bulldogs, and Lenoir-Rhyne was just 1-of-10 from behind the arc.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
